page.title: 01Ecology of Saxilby Area
page.content: This block is rural in situation. Land cover is chiefly arable, most of the houses and amenities being concentrated in Saxilby-with-Ingleby. This village is bounded on the south by the A57 trunk road only 25 feet above sea level. The land rises to approximately 60 feet above sea level near the church and falls away to both east and west to the River Till and accomodation drains respectively. The soil consists of a somewhat heavy but fertile loam overlying a clay subsoil which is well drained to appropriate ditches and dykes. Broxholme is divided from Saxilby by the River Till about 25 feet above sea level, the land rising to about 40 feet above sea level on the north/south road through the hamlet. The soil is heavy clay and loam over well drained subsoil.
